name: You Are Driving Me Nuts! Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many products did American scientist and inventor George Washington Carver develop from the peanut?
questions.explanation:
145.

	George Washington Carver was born near Diamond, Missouri, around 1864, to slave parents. He researched over 300 uses for this versatile nut.

questions.text: What nut is the fruit of an evergreen tree, that is found on the banks of the Amazon and Orinoco Rivers?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	The trees grow up to 135 feet and the nuts which grow in clumps are a valuable source of natural oils.

questions.text: The hazelnut is also know as 'cockle nut'. True or false?
questions.explanation:
false & f.

	The other names for the hazelnut are filbert and cobnut.

questions.text: According to local legend, the Sultan of which southern Iberian Province, thought he was seeing snow for the first time, when he set eyes on a field of almond blossoms?
questions.explanation:
Algarve.

	These are now all provinces of Portugal, which were all at one time under Moorish control. The Algarve, being the southernmost, had extensive groves of almond trees.

questions.correct: The dried kernel of the coconut fruit
options: The hard shell of a macadamia nut
The green casing of a walnut
The cup that surrounds an acorn
questions.explanation:
The dried kernel of the coconut fruit.

	The copra is a valuable source of oil, which is used in the making of margarine and also soap.

questions.text: Which nut grows in a bean shape that forms under an apple-like fruit?
questions.explanation:
Cashew.

	Cashews come from an evergreen shrub or small tree found in the tropics.

questions.text: Which North American nut consists of seventy percent fat and is used mainly in desserts?
questions.explanation:
Pecan.

	The pecan resembles a smooth shelled walnut and is valued for its flavour.

questions.text: What colour is the fruit of which the pistachio nut is the seed?
questions.explanation:
Red.

	The wrinkled red fruit comes from a deciduous tree, which is native to the Mediterranean region and Eastern Asia. The pistachio nut is green.

questions.text: Which nut, native to South America and coming from an annual leguminus plant, is now grown in most areas of the world?
questions.explanation:
Peanut.

	The major producers of peanuts are China and India. The peanut is a distant relative of the pea.

questions.text: Which nut comes from a tree native to the temperate areas of the Northern Hemisphere and at high elevations in the tropics?
questions.explanation:
Acorn.

	Acorns, the fruit of the oak tree, of which there are approximately 600 species, are surrounded by a cup. My apologies to all the nuts not featured in this quiz, maybe another time ...
